title: Property Management / Real Estate Admin
job_overview:
We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented, and highly organized Real Estate / Property Management Admin Assistant to support an entrepreneur in the real estate industry. The ideal candidate has excellent time management skills, can handle sensitive information with discretion, and thrives in a fast-paced, remote work environment. We are specifically looking for individuals who are polished, professional, and highly organized. Familiarity with basic bookkeeping is a plus but not required.

You will play a key role in ensuring smooth day-to-day operations by providing high-level administrative support, managing schedules, coordinating communications, and assisting with light financial tasks when needed. A neutral to no accent is preferred, and professionalism is essential in both written and verbal communication.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
- Provide administrative support to the real estate/property management team, including calendar management, email - handling, and scheduling.
- Perform accurate and efficient data entry and document management.
- Prepare, format, and proofread reports, presentations, and internal documentation.
- Assist with time-sensitive projects and ensure timely task execution.
- Support bookkeeping tasks (e.g., expense tracking, invoice monitoring) if applicable.
- Utilize Rent Manager or similar property management tools (experience is a plus).
- Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with integrity.
- Provide general administrative support and assist with office coordination as needed.

Requirements:
- Experience with Upgrade to see actual info is a plus.
- Rent Manager experience is a plus.
- Familiarity with basic bookkeeping is an advantage.
- Proven experience as a Real Estate Admin Assistant, Property Management Assistant, Executive Assistant, Virtual Assistant, or in a similar administrative role.
- Excellent communication skills—both verbal and written—with a neutral or no accent.
- Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize effectively.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and CRM systems.
- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and collaborate within a team.
- High attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
- Adaptability and flexibility to meet changing priorities and business needs.
- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience is preferred but not required.
- Willingness to undergo a background check.

More info:
This is a work-from-home opportunity and a full-time position requiring 40 hours per week. You will need a steadfast computer with a reliable and consistent high-speed internet connection. You will need to ensure that you have a designated workspace that will allow you to focus and work uninterruptedly.

Compensation + Perks:
- Salary based on experience and expertise
- Long-term employment focus with opportunities for mutual growth
- Monthly benefits package starting after 6 months: Premium healthcare plan, Paid holidays and vacation days, Additional incentives
- Annual performance reviews for potential salary increases
- Monthly virtual team-building events with fun activities, games, and rewards
